verses.verse: Now <WG1161> I Paul <WG3972> myself beseech <WG3870> you by the meekness <WG4236> and gentleness <WG1932> of Christ, <WG5547> who <WG3739> in presence <WG4383> am base <WG5011> among <WG1722> you, but being absent <WG548> am bold <WG2292> toward <WG1519> you:

But I beseech <WG1189> you, that I may not be bold <WG2292> when I am present <WG3918> with that confidence, <WG4006> with which <WG3739> I think <WG3049> to be bold <WG5111> against <WG1909> some, <WG5100> which <WG3588> think <WG3049> of us as if we walked <WG4043> according <WG2596> to the flesh. <WG4561>
For though we walk <WG4043> in the flesh, <WG4561> we do not war <WG4754> after <WG2596> the flesh: <WG4561>
(For the weapons <WG3696> of our warfare <WG4752> are not carnal, <WG4559> but mighty <WG1415> through God <WG2316> to the pulling <WG2506> down <WG2506> of strong <WG3794> holds; <WG3794>)

Casting <WG2507> down <WG2506> imaginations, <WG3053> and every <WG3956> high <WG5313> thing <WG5313> that exalts <WG1869> itself against <WG2596> the knowledge <WG1108> of God, <WG2316> and bringing <WG163> into captivity <WG163> every <WG3956> thought <WG3540> to the obedience <WG5218> of Christ; <WG5547>
And having <WG2192> in a readiness <WG2092> to revenge <WG1556> all <WG3956> disobedience, <WG3876> when <WG3752> your <WG5216> obedience <WG5218> is fulfilled. <WG4137>

Do you look <WG991> on <WG991> things after <WG2596> the outward <WG4383> appearance? <WG4383> If <WG1487> any <WG5100> man trust <WG3982> to himself <WG1438> that he is Christ's, <WG5547> let him of himself <WG1438> think <WG3049> this <WG5124> again, <WG3825> that, as he is Christ's, <WG5547> even <WG2532> so <WG3779> are we Christ's. <WG5547>

For though <WG1437> I should boast <WG2744> somewhat <WG5100> more <WG4055> of our authority, <WG1849> which <WG3739> the Lord <WG2962> has given <WG1325> us for edification, <WG3619> and not for your <WG5216> destruction, <WG2506> I should not be ashamed: <WG153>
That I may not seem <WG1380> as if I would terrify <WG1629> you by letters. <WG1992>
For his letters, <WG1992> say <WG5346> they, are weighty <WG926> and powerful; <WG2478> but his bodily <WG4983> presence <WG3952> is weak, <WG770> and his speech <WG3056> contemptible. <WG1848>

Let such <WG3634> an one think <WG3049> this, <WG5124> that, such <WG5108> as we are in word <WG3056> by letters <WG1992> when we are absent, <WG548> such <WG5108> will we be also <WG2532> in deed <WG2041> when we are present. <WG3918>

For we dare <WG5111> not make ourselves <WG1438> of the number, <WG1469> or <WG2228> compare <WG4793> ourselves <WG1438> with some <WG5100> that commend <WG4921> themselves: <WG1438> but they measuring <WG3354> themselves <WG1438> by themselves, <WG1438> and comparing <WG4793> themselves <WG1438> among themselves, <WG1438> are not wise. <WG4920>

But we will not boast <WG2744> of things without <WG280> our measure, <WG280> but according <WG2596> to the measure <WG3358> of the rule <WG2583> which <WG3739> God <WG2316> has distributed <WG3307> to us, a measure <WG3358> to reach <WG2185> even <WG2532> to you.

For we stretch <WG5239> not ourselves <WG1438> beyond <WG5239> our measure, as though we reached <WG2185> not to you: for we are come <WG5348> as far <WG891> as to you also <WG2532> in preaching <WG2782> the gospel <WG2098> of Christ: <WG5547>

Not boasting <WG2744> of things without <WG280> our measure, <WG280> that is, of other <WG245> men's labors; <WG2873> but having <WG2192> hope, <WG1680> when your <WG5216> faith <WG4102> is increased, <WG837> that we shall be enlarged <WG3170> by you according <WG2596> to our rule <WG2583> abundantly, <WG1519>
To preach <WG2097> the gospel <WG2097> in the regions beyond <WG5238> you, and not to boast <WG2744> in another <WG245> man's <WG245> line <WG2583> of things made <WG2092> ready <WG2092> to our hand.
But he that glories, <WG2744> let him glory <WG2744> in the Lord. <WG2962>
For not he that commends <WG4921> himself <WG1438> is approved, <WG1384> but whom <WG3739> the Lord <WG2962> commends. <WG4921>
